functionalArea.name: Refereeing
functionalArea.description:
Identify, inspect and propose Base Camp (pairing training site & hotel) to Referee Lead

Ensure referee requirements (including VAR) are understood by FIFA working group

Ensure Base Camp meets all requirement at the requested standards

Ensure venue hotel and training site accessibility requirements are met at the mandatory standards

RLO selection, training and on-boarding

Integrate VAR operations

charterComponents.text: Identify, inspect and propose Base Camp (pairing training site & hotel) to Referee Lead Ensure referee requirements (including VAR) are understood by FIFA working group Ensure Base Camp meets all requirement at the requested standards Ensure venue hotel and training site accessibility requirements are met at the mandatory standards Referee Lilaison Officer selection, training and on-boarding Integrate VAR operations

functionalArea.name: Workforce
functionalArea.description:
Delivering Competitions requires the involvement of a significant number of individuals. Due to the time-limited nature of Competitions, many individuals are hired on fixed-term contracts from as little as a few weeks before the start of the Competition up to a few years before.

FIFA will be responsible for managing the workforce working for FIFA, as well as all employees hired locally within Local Entities. This includes all individuals within the Local Entities hired to fulfil the Member Association’s responsibilities.

All employees hired within the Local Entities will be required to adhere to the relevant HR policies and procedures put in place by FIFA.

charterComponents.text: Delivering Competitions requires the involvement of a significant number of individuals. Due to the  time-limited nature of Competitions, many individuals are hired on fixed-term contracts from as little as a few weeks before the start of the Competition up to a few years before. FIFA will be responsible for managing the workforce working for FIFA, as well as all employees hired locally within Local Entities. This includes all individuals within the Local Entities hired to fulfil the Member Association’s responsibilities. All employees hired within the Local Entities will be required to adhere to the relevant HR policies and procedures put in place by FIFA.

functionalArea.name: Marketing Rights Delivery
functionalArea.description:
Implementation of Marketing Rights Programmes granted to Commercial Affiliates in their Sponsorship Agreements.

Commercial Affiliates means official sponsors. They sponsor the Competitions financially, as well as with their products/services supplied as Value in Kind (VIK) in exchange for using Marketing Rights in their brand communications in conjunction with FIFA Competitions.

charterComponents.text: Implementation of Marketing Rights Programmes granted to Commercial Affiliates in their Sponsorship Agreements. Commercial Affiliates means official sponsors. They sponsor the Competitions financially, as well as with their products/services supplied as Value in Kind (VIK) in exchange for using Marketing Rights in their brand communications in conjunction with FIFA Competitions.

functionalArea.name: Ticketing
functionalArea.description: Responsible for all conceptual, operational and managerial measures to provide Tickets to all spectators of every Match and/or certain Competition-related Events allowing them to enter the Stadium or respective other Site, obtain a seat and watch the Match and/or Competition-related Event as well as other performances related thereto. Ticketing shall include the management and operation necessary for the allocation, production, sale, distribution, delivery and payment of Tickets of the Competitions.

charterComponents.text: Responsible for all conceptual, operational and managerial measures to provide Tickets to all spectators of every Match and/or certain Competition-related Events allowing them to enter the Stadium or respective other Site, obtain a seat and watch the Match and/or Competition-related Event as well as other performances related thereto. Ticketing shall include the management and operation necessary for the allocation, production, sale, distribution, delivery and payment of Tickets of the Competitions.

functionalArea.name: Hospitality
functionalArea.description: Oversee the central Project management of the Commercial Hospitality and FIFA Affiliates Hospitality Programmes.

charterComponents.text: Oversee the central Project management of the Commercial Hospitality and FIFA Affiliates Hospitality Programmes.

functionalArea.name: Team Services
functionalArea.description:
Ensures the best available team training facilities and related equipment are delivered.

Planning and implementing all team operations and coordinating with relevant Functional Areas (Transport, Logistics, Security, etc.)

Communication channel with the PMAs.

Perform a dual role delivering certain services directly to Teams as well as ensuring the coordination of all other services provided to Teams.

FIFA are responsible for the Team Services function but rely on the support of the Member Associations in certain areas.

charterComponents.text: Ensures the best available team training facilities and related equipment are delivered.Planning and implementing all team operations and coordinating with relevant Functional Areas (Transport, Logistics, Security, etc.)Communication channel with the Participating Member Associations.Perform a dual role delivering certain services directly to Teams as well as ensuring the coordination of all other services provided to Teams.FIFA are responsible for the Team Services function but rely on the support of the Member Associations in certain areas.

functionalArea.name: Guest Operations
functionalArea.description:
VIP/VVIP Guest Management activities for the Competitions and Competition-related Events include: VIP/VVIP Ticketing; VIP/VVIP Hospitality; Hostesses and Volunteers for VIPs/VVIPs areas; FIFA Club for selected VIPs/VVIPs (depending on level of Competition); Airport service for VIPs/VVIPs; FIFA uniforms; Gifts and give-aways for VIPs/VVIPs

FIFA Guest Management is also responsible for the coordination of all cross-divisional needs according the VIP/VVIP Guest Management service levels together with the relevant FIFA and LOC Departments as well as external suppliers in regards to: Accommodation for VIPs/VVIPs; Transportation arrangements as well as parking for VIPs/VVIPs; Security arrangements for VIPs/VVIPs; Accreditation for VIP/VVIP areas; Medical services for VIPs/VVIPs

charterComponents.text: VIP/VVIP Guest Management activities for the Competitions and Competition-related Events include: VIP/VVIP  Ticketing; VIP/VVIP  Hospitality; Hostesses and Volunteers for VIPs/VVIPs areas; FIFA Club for selected VIPs/VVIPs (depending on level of Competition); Airport service for VIPs/VVIPs; FIFA  uniforms; Gifts and give-aways for VIPs/VVIPs FIFA Guest Management is also responsible for the coordination of all cross-divisional needs according the VIP/VVIP Guest Management service levels together with the relevant FIFA and LOC Departments as well as external suppliers in regards to: Accommodation for VIPs/VVIPs; Transportation arrangements as well as parking for VIPs/VVIPs; Security arrangements for VIPs/VVIPs; Accreditation for VIP/VVIP areas; Medical services for VIPs/VVIPs

functionalArea.name: Media Operations
functionalArea.description: Manage Media facilities required for Competitions and Media Services to be provided during Competitions.

charterComponents.text: Manage Media facilities required for Competitions and Media Services to be provided during Competitions.

data.name: Host Broadcast Production and Broadcast Servicing

functionalArea.name: Broadcast Services
functionalArea.description: Responsible for ensuring that Media Rights Licensees are serviced to the highest possible standard. The primary goal is to ensure that all rights and obligations set out in each Media Rights Agreement are delivered and adhered to.

charterComponents.text: Responsible for ensuring that Media Rights Licensees are serviced to the highest possible standard. The primary goal is to ensure that all rights and obligations set out in each Media Rights Agreement are delivered and adhered to.

functionalArea.name: Fan Fest
functionalArea.description: FIFA develops the FFF Strategy and Concept and issues the FFF Event Manual, which details the operational requirements for the Host Cities. It will, throughout the Project, be responsible for the centralised Project Management of the FIFA Fan Fest to ensure quality and consistency across all Sites within all Host Cities of the Host Countries.

charterComponents.text: FIFA develops the Fifa Fan Fest Strategy and Concept and issues the Fifa Fan Fest Event Manual, which details the operational requirements for the Host Cities. It will, throughout the Project, be responsible for the centralised Project Management of the FIFA Fan Fest to ensure quality and consistency across all Sites within all Host Cities of the Host Countries.

functionalArea.name: Competition Management
functionalArea.description:
Ensures ownership and guidance of all Competition related matters such as Draw Procedures and Match Schedules for all FIFA's tournaments.

Liaises and works closely with Competition Directors from the Confederations and Member Associations in order to align planning and objectives.

Responsible for all match organisation, preparation, planning and requirements to ensure smooth running of all matches, providing the best possible conditions for the teams and referees in collaboration with other Functional Areas.

charterComponents.text: Ensures ownership and guidance of all Competition related matters such as Draw Procedures and Match Schedules for all FIFA's tournaments. Liaises and works closely with Competition Directors from the Confederations and Member Associations in order to align planning and objectives. Responsible for all match organisation, preparation, planning and requirements to ensure smooth running of all matches, providing the best possible conditions for the teams and referees in collaboration with other Functional Areas.

functionalArea.name: Women's Football Competitions
functionalArea.description:
The aim of the Women's Football division is to improve all aspects of women's competitions as well as the development of the game and players themselves from grassroots up to national teams.

Performed through different development programs and a constant review of existing and ongoing projects

Contribute to FIFA 2.0's objective of building a stronger institution, with a focus on building up a healthy and successful community of women in football all over the world.

charterComponents.text: The aim of the Women's Football division is to improve all aspects of women's competitions as well as the development of the game and players themselves from grassroots up to national teams. Performed through different development programs and a constant review of existing and ongoing projects Contribute to FIFA 2.0's objective of building a stronger institution, with a focus on building up a healthy and successful community of women in football all over the world.

functionalArea.name: Safety & Security
functionalArea.description:
Responsible for managing all aspects of Safety and Security for Competitions and competition related events, in line with the Hosting Agreement and contractual requirements.

Safety refers to the preventative measures required to mitigate any consequences of structural failure, planning error or operational accidents that could threaten event procedures or participants including Teams, Officials, Spectators and Staff.

charterComponents.text: Responsible for managing all aspects of Safety and Security for Competitions and competition related events, in line with the Hosting Agreement and contractual requirements. Safety refers to the preventative measures required to mitigate any consequences of structural failure, planning error or operational accidents that could threaten event procedures or participants including Teams, Officials, Spectators and Staff.

functionalArea.name: Access Management
functionalArea.description:
Implementation of policies, systems and infrastructure to ensure all authorised personnel and vehicles can access working areas in a timely manner.

In general, FIFA will be responsible for the development of the access management concept and the implementation of the access control operations, however, the Member Associations and other Host Country stakeholders will be required to support the project in specific areas.

charterComponents.text: Implementation of policies, systems and infrastructure to ensure all authorised personnel and vehicles can access working areas in a timely manner. In general, FIFA will be responsible for the development of the access management concept and the implementation of the access control operations, however, the Member Associations and other Host Country stakeholders will be required to support the project in specific areas.

functionalArea.name: Accreditation
functionalArea.description:
Implementation of an Accreditation System at Competitions

Concept for the production, issue and control of, and the Accreditation Application Process for Accreditation Devices

Concept of the security check and the cooperation with national security authorities regarding security checks of Accreditation Applicants’ data

Number and locations of Accreditation Centres

Acknowledging the use of the FIFA Accreditation IT System for the application and issuing processes of Accreditation Cards

Control mechanisms and services at all Site entry points

charterComponents.text: Implementation of an Accreditation System at Competitions Concept for the production, issue and control of, and the Accreditation Application Process for Accreditation Devices Concept of the security check and the cooperation with national security authorities regarding security checks of Accreditation Applicants’ data Number and locations of Accreditation Centres Acknowledging the use of the FIFA Accreditation IT System for the application and issuing processes of Accreditation Cards Control mechanisms and services at all Site entry points

functionalArea.name: Volunteers
functionalArea.description:
Focus on:

  • Delivering Volunteer Centres at each Venue

  • Development of the concept of operations and staffing structure

  • Development of a concept which is aligned to the vision of the Competitions and the organisation

  • A uniform standard Volunteer Programme across all the Host Cities

  • Appointment and training of Volunteer Project staff

  • Development of the cost management structure and financial controls

  • Recruitment and selection of sufficient Volunteers

  • Development and implementation of the Volunteer Management System

  • Develop the Volunteer training and induction framework

  • Provision of a trained Volunteer workforce

  • Provision of incentives in order to sustain Volunteer participation in the Project

  • Management of Volunteer expectations, by communicating from the onset what will be provided to them and what will not be provided

  • Monitoring and evaluation of the Volunteer Project

charterComponents.text: Focus on: Delivering Volunteer Centres at each Venue Development of the concept of operations and staffing structure Development of a concept which is aligned to the vision of the Competitions and the organisation A uniform standard Volunteer Programme across all the Host Cities Appointment and training of Volunteer Project staff Development of the cost management structure and financial controls Recruitment and selection of sufficient Volunteers Development and implementation of the Volunteer Management System Develop the Volunteer training and induction framework Provision of a trained Volunteer workforce Provision of incentives in order to sustain Volunteer participation in the Project Management of Volunteer expectations, by communicating from the onset what will be provided to them and what will not be provided Monitoring and evaluation of the Volunteer Project

functionalArea.name: Technical Services
functionalArea.description:
Oversee essential technical installations required to support Site infrastructure and operations.

The following elements will be covered as part of Technical Services:

  • Power

  • Heating

  • Ventilation and Air Conditioning

  • Cabling and Containment

  • Sanitary Facilities

  • Water Supply and Plumbing

  • Lighting

charterComponents.text: Oversee essential technical installations required to support Site infrastructure and operations. The following elements will be covered as part of Technical Services: Power Heating Ventilation and Air Conditioning Cabling and Containment Sanitary Facilities Water Supply and Plumbing Lighting

functionalArea.name: Cleaning & Waste Management
functionalArea.description:
Cleaning Services mainly deal with the removal of undesirable substances from surfaces with the aim of: improving visual appearance; producing hygienic conditions; increasing safety by minimising the likelihood of accidents.

Waste Management Services mainly deal with the disposal (i.e. the removal of waste from the Waste Collection Compounds to the appropriate final destination), sorting and recycling of solid waste as well as liquids and sewage.

charterComponents.text: Cleaning Services mainly deal with the removal of undesirable substances from surfaces with the aim of:  improving visual appearance; producing hygienic conditions; increasing safety by minimising the likelihood of accidents. Waste Management Services mainly deal with the disposal (i.e. the removal of waste from the Waste Collection Compounds to the appropriate final destination), sorting and recycling of solid waste as well as liquids and sewage.

functionalArea.name: Dressing & Signage
functionalArea.description: Dressing & Signage generally manages the decorative and directional attributes of the visual appearance at official Sites, Competition-related Events, and Stadiums and in Protocol Routes. The Dressing & Signage features the Competition Marks consistently across all the visual communications in association with the Competitions.

charterComponents.text: Dressing & Signage generally manages the decorative and directional attributes of the visual appearance at official Sites, Competition-related Events, and Stadiums and in Protocol Routes. The Dressing & Signage features the Competition Marks consistently across all the visual communications in association with the Competitions.

functionalArea.name: Venue Management
functionalArea.description: Ensure a consistent level of quality across all Venues and ensure that the Venues are operational (infrastructure completed and operations ready) within budget and timeline, with all Functional Areas involved appropriately.

charterComponents.text: Ensure a consistent level of quality across all Venues and ensure that the Venues are operational (infrastructure completed and operations ready) within budget and timeline, with all Functional Areas involved appropriately.

functionalArea.name: Show Production & Stadium Entertainment (incl. Infotainment)
functionalArea.description:
Producing a Stadium Entertainment program for PA & Giant Screen program delivered from ​Stadium Infotainment Gallery & IBC Infotainment Gallery​

Delivering Audio Visual support for FIFA Pre Match, Opening & Final Ceremonies

Delivering match feed, replay protocol and VAR decision announcements

Supporting delivery of Marketing Content

Delivering content produced by various FIFA Teams (Communications, Digital, Foundation, FIFA Films, Sustainability & Diversity, Safety & Security, etc.)​.

charterComponents.text: Producing a Stadium Entertainment program for PA & Giant Screen program delivered from ?Stadium Infotainment Gallery & IBC Infotainment Gallery? Delivering Audio Visual support for FIFA Pre Match, Opening & Final Ceremonies Delivering match feed, replay protocol and VAR decision announcements Supporting delivery of  Marketing Content Delivering content produced by various FIFA Teams (Communications, Digital, Foundation, FIFA Films, Sustainability & Diversity, Safety & Security, etc.)?.

functionalArea.name: Stadium & Infrastructure Management
functionalArea.description: Oversee all Stadium specific requirements that apply to all infrastructure, facilities in and around the Stadiums and other Sites required for the competition.

charterComponents.text: Oversee all Stadium specific requirements that apply to all infrastructure, facilities in and around the Stadiums and other Sites required for the competition.

functionalArea.name: Pitch Management
functionalArea.description: Oversee a timely delivery of the appropriate number of Pitches according to FIFA specification in all relevant locations of the Competition and maintain them to the specified standard throughout the Competition.

charterComponents.text: Oversee a timely delivery of the appropriate number of Pitches according to FIFA specification in all relevant locations of the Competition and maintain them to the specified standard throughout the Competition.

functionalArea.name: Training Site Management
functionalArea.description: Ensures that Training Sites are designed according to the highest international standards and in accordance with all FIFA requirements.

charterComponents.text: Ensures that Training Sites are designed according to the highest international standards and in accordance with all FIFA requirements.

functionalArea.name: Special Events
functionalArea.description:
Draws:

Expected to be jointly owned between FIFA and Host Countries. FIFA, jointly under Special Events and Competition Management team, provides the conditions and framework for the Local Entities to build its Project.

Ceremonies:

Jointly headed by Special Event and Dedicated Project Team: Provides requirements, tools and guidance; Approves Ceremonies Concepts/content/pitch protection plan; Creative Content, relevant timelines, etc; ensures Stadiums are being properly used by participants of the Ceremonies ; Defining spaces, rehearsal times, etc.

charterComponents.text: Draws: Expected to be jointly owned between FIFA and Host Countries. FIFA,  jointly under Special Events and Competition Management team, provides the conditions and framework for the Local Entities to build its Project. Ceremonies: Jointly headed by Special Event and Dedicated Project Team: Provides requirements, tools and guidance; Approves Ceremonies Concepts/content/pitch protection plan; Creative Content, relevant timelines, etc; ensures Stadiums are being properly used by participants of the Ceremonies ; Defining spaces, rehearsal times, etc.

functionalArea.name: Accommodation
functionalArea.description: Accommodation operations is about allocating based on FIFA instructions, selling and managing the room inventory, which is mainly the task of a FIFA-run or third-party Accommodation Service Provider, appointed and supervised by FIFA and supported by Local Entities.

charterComponents.text: Accommodation operations is about allocating based on FIFA instructions, selling and managing the room inventory, which is mainly the task of a FIFA-run or third-party Accommodation Service Provider, appointed and supervised by FIFA and supported by Local Entities.

functionalArea.name: Logistics
functionalArea.description: Responsible for securing simplified import and export customs procedures and implementation thereof, to operate warehouse and distribution services, and to ensure the logistics infrastructure and operation at Competition related Sites.

charterComponents.text: Responsible for securing simplified import and export customs procedures and implementation thereof, to operate warehouse and distribution services, and to ensure the logistics infrastructure and operation at Competition related Sites.

functionalArea.name: Transportation
functionalArea.description: Planning, development and organisation of Transport Services for all FIFA and Host Country Constituent Groups; Integration of security principles (Sites, perimeters, routings, etc.) and implementation control; Monitoring of compliance with any environmental policy and contribution to the Sustainability Project; Planning and management of all Transport fleet vehicles (buses and cars), to include scope and allocation, depots, maintenance, re-fuelling, insurance, drivers and training and, when necessary, additional procurement; Specific training, allocation, management of shifts/rostering, and Accommodation etc. of Event Transport staff and Volunteers; Charter Flights/Private Jets/helicopters, intercity planning/coordination; Monitoring and integration of Fan Transport solutions into the overall Transport Plan.

charterComponents.text: Planning, development and organisation of Transport Services for all FIFA and Host Country Constituent Groups; Integration of security principles (Sites, perimeters, routings, etc.) and implementation control; Monitoring of compliance with any environmental policy and contribution to the Sustainability Project; Planning and management of all Transport fleet vehicles (buses and cars), to include scope and allocation, depots, maintenance, re-fuelling, insurance, drivers and training and, when necessary, additional procurement; Specific training, allocation, management of shifts/rostering, and Accommodation etc. of Event Transport staff and Volunteers; Charter Flights/Private Jets/helicopters, intercity planning/coordination; Monitoring and integration of Fan Transport solutions into the overall Transport Plan.

Draws:

Expected to be jointly owned between FIFA and Host Countries. FIFA, jointly under Special Events and Competition Management team, provides the conditions and framework for the Local Entities to build its Project.

Ceremonies:

Jointly headed by Special Event and Dedicated Project Team: Provides requirements, tools and guidance; Approves Ceremonies Concepts/content/pitch protection plan; Creative Content, relevant timelines, etc; ensures Stadiums are being properly used by participants of the Ceremonies ; Defining spaces, rehearsal times, etc.

functionalArea.name: Travel
functionalArea.description: Planning and execution of competition in relation to international air and ground transport services, including travel bookings for teams and delegates, on-site support for guest services and domestic movements overview in close collaboration with Host Countries.

charterComponents.text: Planning and execution of competition in relation to international air and ground transport services, including travel bookings for teams and delegates, on-site support for guest services and domestic movements overview in close collaboration with Host Countries.

functionalArea.name: Football Technology & Innovation
functionalArea.description:
Optimising the elite game; making it fairer, more competitive and keeping it attractive and entertaining.

Facilitate the quantitative & qualitative growth and development of the game – in all football technical areas and at all levels.

charterComponents.text: Optimising the elite game; making it fairer, more competitive and keeping it attractive and entertaining. Facilitate the quantitative & qualitative growth and development of the game – in all football technical areas and at all levels.

functionalArea.name: Media Relations
functionalArea.description: Media Relations manages communication to the media for Competitions

charterComponents.text: Media Relations manages communication to the media for Competitions

functionalArea.name: Brand Management
functionalArea.description: Development of all Competition Marks; Provision of comprehensive usage guidelines for all Competition Marks; Management of access permissions to official artwork of Competition Marks via the FIFA Digital Archive platform (or similar web-based replacement platform); Approval of Host Country and Host City usage requests for Competition Marks submitted over the FIFA Digital Archive platform (or similar web-based replacement platform); Approval of third-party usage requests for Competition Marks submitted over the FIFA Digital Archive platform (or similar web-based replacement platform); Commissions and manages the production process of the Trophy and Event Memorabilia.

charterComponents.text: Development of all Competition Marks; Provision of comprehensive usage guidelines for all Competition Marks; Management of access permissions to official artwork of Competition Marks via the FIFA Digital Archive platform (or similar web-based replacement platform); Approval of Host Country and Host City usage requests for Competition Marks submitted over the FIFA Digital Archive platform (or similar web-based replacement platform); Approval of third-party usage requests for Competition Marks submitted over the FIFA Digital Archive platform (or similar web-based replacement platform); Commissions and manages the production process of the Trophy and Event Memorabilia.

functionalArea.name: Experiential Marketing & Promotion
functionalArea.description: Manage communications on Brand Assets, Destination Marketing, Event Positioning, Event Promotion.

charterComponents.text: Manage communications on Brand Assets, Destination Marketing, Event Positioning, Event Promotion.

functionalArea.name: FIFA Films
functionalArea.description: Central hub for many stakeholders inside and outside the organisation; Valuable commercial archive, providing revenue to FIFA; Forms the basis for much of the content produced in-house for digital channels; Provides a rich seam of inspiration and stories that FIFA Films Content team brings to life through the films that they create.

charterComponents.text: Central hub for many stakeholders inside and outside the organisation; Valuable commercial archive, providing revenue to FIFA; Forms the basis for much of the content produced in-house for digital channels; Provides a rich seam of inspiration and stories that FIFA Films Content team brings to life through the films that they create.

functionalArea.name: Licensing & Retail
functionalArea.description: Securing the strongest rights deals and working with the best providers for every deliverable, such as merchandising production.

charterComponents.text: Securing the strongest rights deals and working with the best providers for every deliverable, such as merchandising production.

functionalArea.name: Finance (Event Controlling)
functionalArea.description: Manage internal accounting and financial reporting as well as MA's budgeting and reporting to FIFA

charterComponents.text: Manage internal accounting and financial reporting as well as MA's budgeting and reporting to FIFA

functionalArea.name: Event IT
functionalArea.description: Responsible for managing the delivery of Information Technology and Telecommunications services which provide the necessary IT Solutions for FIFA, Host Countries, the Host Broadcaster, Media Representatives and other Stakeholders to carry out their respective functions.

charterComponents.text: Responsible for managing the delivery of Information Technology and Telecommunications services which provide the necessary IT Solutions for FIFA, Host Countries, the Host Broadcaster, Media Representatives and other Stakeholders to carry out their respective functions.

functionalArea.name: Language Services
functionalArea.description: Plan and manage translation/editing service and interpreting service.

charterComponents.text: Plan and manage translation/editing service and interpreting service.

functionalArea.name: Event Legal
functionalArea.description: Responsible for a variety of legal issues in different areas and contribute to the reliable process of various matters which are of relevance for FIFA.

charterComponents.text: Responsible for a variety of legal issues in different areas and contribute to the reliable process of various matters which are of relevance for FIFA.

functionalArea.name: Brand Protection
functionalArea.description: FIFA has developed and protected an assortment of logos, words, titles, symbols and other trademarks that it will use, or allow others to use under a formal agreement, in relation to the FIFA World Cup. FIFA is obliged to take action against any unauthorised reproduction of FIFA Intellectual Property in a commercial context.

charterComponents.text: FIFA has developed and protected an assortment of logos, words, titles, symbols and other trademarks that it will use, or allow others to use under a formal agreement, in relation to the FIFA World Cup. FIFA is obliged to take action against any unauthorised reproduction of FIFA Intellectual Property in a commercial context.

functionalArea.name: Medical
functionalArea.description: Medical Services generally refers to the 24/7 medical coverage at all Sites (including Stadiums) and Competition-related Events. The provision of services will be established by Local Entities following FIFA requirements and shall be operative throughout the Competition Periods.

charterComponents.text: Medical Services generally refers to the 24/7 medical coverage at all Sites (including Stadiums) and Competition-related Events. The provision of services will be established by Local Entities following FIFA requirements and shall be operative throughout the Competition Periods.

functionalArea.name: Anti-Doping
functionalArea.description: Doping Controls (urine and/or blood tests) will be carried out by FIFA after all Matches in accordance with the FIFA Anti-Doping Regulations. Typically, four players (two from each Team) will be tested following each Match, but the number can change if deemed necessary by the FIFA Medical Officer.

charterComponents.text: Doping Controls (urine and/or blood tests) will be carried out by FIFA after all Matches in accordance with the FIFA Anti-Doping Regulations. Typically, four players (two from each Team) will be tested following each Match, but the number can change if deemed necessary by the FIFA Medical Officer.

functionalArea.name: Sustainability
functionalArea.description: Sustainability Projects are primarily social and environmental initiatives that are lead and carried out by the Sustainability team (sometimes with the support of other areas) as part of the implementation of the Sustainability Strategy that is developed for Competitions by FIFA and Host Countries.

charterComponents.text: Sustainability Projects are primarily social and environmental initiatives that are lead and carried out by the Sustainability team (sometimes with the support of other areas) as part of the implementation of the Sustainability Strategy that is developed for Competitions by FIFA and Host Countries.

functionalArea.name: Spectator Services
functionalArea.description: Spectator Services relates to the coordination of various operational functions for individuals and groups of individuals that are attending the Competition, with a particular focus on ticket holders. Within the Stadium perimeter, the provision of services to spectators is the responsibility of FIFA and outside of this the responsibility lies with the Host Cities.

charterComponents.text: Spectator Services relates to the coordination of various operational functions for individuals and groups of individuals that are attending the Competition, with a particular focus on ticket holders. Within the Stadium perimeter, the provision of services to spectators is the responsibility of FIFA and outside of this the responsibility lies with the Host Cities.

functionalArea.description: Manage communications on Brand Assets, Destination Marketing, Event Positioning, Event Promotion.

charterComponents.text: Manage communications on Brand Assets, Destination Marketing, Event Positioning, Event Promotion.
